item.title: Report I-2024070084
item.description:
Report I-2024070084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: Atlanta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/07/2024, the Delta Dangerous Goods management team was notified of an undeclared shipment of 2 non-spillable, wet batteries secured to the back bed of two new golf carts. The golf carts did not contain any fluids (oils, fuels), however, the non-spillable wet batteries were removed/disconnected from the battery compartment and placed/strapped to the aft bed of the cart. There was not a shipping paper associated with the batteries. This event is under immediate investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024070326
item.description:
Report E-2024070326

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 9, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3267 was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024070381
item.description:
Report E-2024070381

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On July 8, 2024, at 1745 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Jefferson, Georgia regarding the release of Caustic Soda Prills. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Caustic Soda Prills (UN1823, 8, II). The release was caused by a rollover accident that impacted a 360ft x 50ft area of soil and an adjacent concrete lined drainage ditch that contained 635 gallons of free-standing impacted rainwater. Contractors collected the damaged cargo that was still in the trailer, neutralized and collected all free-standing liquid with a vac truck, excavated all impacted soil, then placed seed and straw. Contractors took 635 gallons of impacted rainwater in a vac truck and 11 roll-offs of impacted soil and damaged cargo offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070369
item.description:
Report E-2024070369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10200
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The IBC was strapped in the trailer by Heritage Crystal Clean (HCC). Heritage Environmental Services (HES) employees unloaded the trailer at the Heritage Transport (HT) transfer facility. HES employees loosen the load strap which exposed a whole in the body of the IBC. The whole was 1 inch or less in size. The whole was located approximately halfway down the side of the body. HES employees secured and blocked nearby storm drains and contact an emergency response contractor to mitigate the release, transfer the remaining contents of the damaged IBC to a new container, to recover the spilled material, and to containerize absorbent materials. The duration of the release was approximately 90 minutes.

item.title: Report E-2024070301
item.description:
Report E-2024070301

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: CALHOUN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and generated one (1) 5-gallon metal pail of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
